ratings.comment: This class inspired me to take more Asia related courses and I may take a major in Chinese. I really liked the short stories and novels we read, and how they're all connected to religion. The Professor always makes everyone think hard about their own cultural background. Informal style, lots of room for questions, interesting discussions. Friendly.

Not what I expected, but if you're interested in the studies it shouldn't be too bad. Found the material hard to grasp or understand at times. The professor seemed knowledgeable of the subject and was open for discussion on some points. Lots of readings, but not all are necessary. Workload is standard.

Taoism showed me a totally different way of thinking that Mark made super interesting and relatable. He is extremely knowledgable in the subject and basically anything East Asia. Grading on papers is fair. Go to class, discuss, and seriously, they'll write themselves. That's coming from an engineering major.

Kind, knowlegable, genuinely wants his students to suceed. You easily can get away with not doing all the readings but it would only would your loss. VERY interesting class! He offers an untraditional (unless, of course, you are a daoist) view on the world that at the very least will make you think. Would reccomend to anyone.

Interesting class, though sometimes slightly complex. Helpful professor, he always starts class discussions, and he gave me super feedback during individual meetings. Exams are all right, I did well on the two midterms, even though I didn't always do the readings.

The Professor is very passionate about his own materials! However, he is very arrogant and he does not like to answer students' questions. The midterms are vague not necessary hard. The class materials are confusing that makes you less interested approaching the final.
This man is a very passionate professor. He has very energetic lectures and is enthusiastic about the topic. Definately worth it.

I took this course for credit requirement and basically had almost no prior interest. But this ended up being easily one of my most memorable classes. Professor is very enthusiastic and obviously loves to teach, his lectures are energetic so you will stay focused. Nice guy, too. Two thumbs up.
Taoism is now officially my favorite religion! Fun class, enjoyed it, recommend it. Will definitely try to take another class with this professor.

This has been a great semester. Taoism is strange but also strangely appealing and Mark highlights the most interesting truths in such a way that you feel you already knew it as a human being; you can connect to it. I would recommend this class to anyone, even though it is not always easy. I learned so much! Plenty and good class discussions.

Overall, an egotistic professor that assigns a plethora of reading but does not care for your opinion in class therefore makes reading useless. Very superficial (fake) and comes off very charming and nice but upon few more attendance in class you will discover that he is arrogant and is absolutely cold internally. It's his way or the high way.

Great class, very knowledgeable professor. Bends over backwards to help you. Super interesting lectures, awesome pictures, just that some students obviously took the class for an easy pass. If your interested in traditional Chinese culture, EA371 won't disappoint you. Tough garder, tho!

Loose guidelines makes it hard to follow the professor and to know what is expected. The class is somewhat interesting but the prompts for the essays are usually very vague and require a lot of work with the TA

Dont take this class with this professor, you will have a lot of reading to read every week. Although his class is a relatively class of literature, you will be given an final exam asking the boring class materials.

Pointless discussions because he never fully explains the contexts at class. And he likes to help his students by giving them unconstructive comments. Require a textbook that's 50 dollars but he is just going to use it for 2 days. BAD CHOICE FOR LITERATURE ELECTIVE!

Definition of goofy European. Totally nice guy though. As all humanities classes are, a little scatter-brained and loose. But still, a great introduction into a difficult religion. Mark is a really nice guy and means well, although i suspect that behind the scenes he has a little scholarly arrogance. nonetheless, TAKE THIS CLASS
Awesome! One of my favorite professors ever. He is a fair grader and test-writer. His accent will keep you paying attention, too! :)

Haven't finished the course yet, but so far, I have mixed feelings. He's very enthusiastic but sometimes reacts strangely to questions. I did well on the midterm, but I definitely had to put in the work. Overall, he's alright so far. He dresses nicely, too.
